Default: THE AIR HANDLING SYSTEMS SHALL BE CONTROLLED BY THE BUILDING DDC SYSTEM. ACTUATORS AND OPERATORS SHALL BE ELECTRONIC. 2.THE AIR HANDLING SYSTEM SHALL INCLUDE TIME OF DAY CONTROL SEQUENCE. THE INITIAL START/STOP SCHEDULE SHALL BE COORDINATED WITH THE BUILDING OPERATOR.
Economizer_operation: THE AIR HANDLING UNIT SHALL OPERATE IN HEATING,VENTILATION, COOLING, AND SAFETY MODES AS FOLLOWS (ALL SET POINTS AND SETTINGS SHALL BE ADJUSTABLE). 1. THE SUPPLY AIR TEMPERATURE IS CONTROLLED BASED ON THE DISCHARGE AIR DUCT TEMPERATURE SENSOR SET AT 55°F. (ADJ)THE PRE-HEAT, AND COOLING COIL SHALL MODULATE WITHOUT OVERLAP TO MAINTAIN SETPOINT TEMPERATURE.2.WHEN THE OUTSIDE ENTHALPY IS BELOW THE RETURN AIR ENTHALPY, MIXED AIR ECONOMIZER DAMPERS MODULATE IN SEQUENCE WITHOUT OVERLAP TO MAINTAIN THE SUPPLY TEMPERATURE SET POINT (ADJ). THE ECONOMIZER MIXING DAMPERS RAMP OPEN SLOWLY TO MINIMIZE OVERSHOOTING.3.WHEN THE OUTSIDE AIR ENTHALPY IS ABOVE THE RETURN AIR ENTHALPY, THE ECONOMIZER OSA DAMPERS SHALL CLOSE. MINIMUM OSA DAMPER SHALL MAINTAIN MINIMUM OUTSIDE AIR VALUES (REFER TO AIR HANDLING UNITS SCHEDULES FOR MIN/MAX OUTSIDE AIR VALUES)4.THE DDC SYSTEM SHALL SEND A SUPPLY AIR TEMPERATURE RESET SIGNAL TO UNIT CONTROLS. THE SUPPLY AIR TEMPERATURE SHALL BE RESET UPWARDS FROM 55°F (UP TO A MAXIMUM OF 65°F). (ADJ) DISCHARGE TEMPERATURE SHALL BE RESET BY THE ZONE REQUIRING THE MOST COOLING. AS THE COOLEST ZONE TEMPERATURE DROPS FROM SET POINT TO 2 DEGREES F BELOW SETPOINT THE DISCHARGE AIR TEMPERATURE SETPOINT SHALL BE RESET UPWARDS FROM 55 DEGREES TO 65 DEGREES. RESET SHALL BE OVERRIDEN TO 55F  DEGREES WHEN RETURN BUILDING HUMIDITY RISES ABOVE 55F DEWPOINT.5.WHEN THE SYSTEM IS PLACED IN THE OFF POSITION, THE OUTSIDE AIR, RELIEF AIR ECONOMIZER DAMPER . , HEATING AND COOLING CONTROL VALVES SHALL MODULATE TO THE CLOSED POSITION.  MIXED AIR DAMPER SHALL MODULATE OPEN.
night_setback: THE SYSTEM SHALL OPERATE DURING NIGHT SETBACK  MODE AS FOLLOWS: 1.THE SYSTEM IS CONTROLLED USING THE NIGHT SET BACK POINTS. THE CONTROLLER MAY RESET TO THE OCCUPIED MODE FOR A PREDETERMINED TIME PERIOD UPON A SIGNAL FROM THE CONTROL SYSTEM OR MANUALLY AT THE ROOM SENSOR. NIGHT SET BACK SHALL BE ACTIVATED UPON SIGNAL FROM ANY VAV ZONES. 2.IN ADDITION, DURING NIGHT SETBACK  HOURS, SYSTEM SHALL BE RE-STARTED WHENEVER THE SPACE TEMPERATURE RISES/FALLS ABOVE/BELOW THE NIGHT TEMPERATURE SET POINT OF 85°F IN THE SUMMER AND 55°F IN THE WINTER. UNIT SHALL OPERATE FOR MINIMUM 60 MINUTES IF CALL FOR START UP.3.DURING NIGHT SETBACK MODE, OUTSIDE AIR DAMPER SHALL BE CLOSED WHEN OUTSIDE ENTHALPY IS ABOVE THE RETURN AIR ENTHALPY.
Freeze_protection: 1.UNIT ON: IF THE FREEZE THERMOSTAT INDICATES A LOW LIMIT CONDITION (36F) THE PREHEAT COIL SHALL MODULATE OPEN UNTIL TEMPERATURE RISES ABOVE LOW LIMIT CONDITION. IF TEMPERATURE CONTINUES TO DROP BELOW THE  LOW LIMIT CONDITION THE OUTSIDE AIR AND RELIEF AIR DAMPERS SHALL CLOSE AND MIXED AIR DAMPER SHALL OPEN TO 100% FOR FREEZE PROTECTION.2.UNIT OFF: IF THE FREEZE THERMOSTAT INDICATES A LOW LIMIT CONDITION (36F) . THE OUTSIDE AIR AND RELIEF AIR DAMPERS SHALL REMAIN CLOSED. THE PREHEAT COIL SHALL MODULATE OPEN UNTIL TEMPERATURE RISES ABOVE LOW LIMIT CONDITION.
Filters: THE PRESSURE LOSS THROUGH THE FILTERS SHALL BE MONITORED AT THE DDC SYSTEM AND AN ALARM SHALL BE GENERATED WHEN THE PRESSURE LOSS EXCEEDS THE ALLOWABLE FILTER PRESSURE LOSS.
Demand_control_vent: IF THE CRITICAL ZONE RISES ABOVE 700 PPM THE MINIMUM OUTSIDE AIR CFM SETPOINT WILL BE RESET BASED ON THE WORST CASE ZONE CO2 LEVEL. A PID LOOP WILL MAINTAIN THE CO2 LEVEL AT BELOW 700 PPM (ADJ) SETPOINT BY RESETTING THE OUTSIDE AIR MINIMUM CFM SETPOINT BETWEEN THE UPPER MINIMUM  INDICATED ON THE SCHEDULES AND LOWER MINIMUM CFM SETPOINTS. THE LOWER CFM MINIMUM CFM SETOINT WILL BE EQUAL TO THE GREATER OF THE VALUES LISTED ON THE DESIGN.
